meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Ah, Paper Trail, you've got me folded up in knots! (Sorry, had to get one origami pun out of the way early). In all seriousness, this charming puzzle game has won over many critics and players alike with its unique mechanics and beautiful hand-drawn art. But let's get to the nitty-gritty - is it worth your time?

Well, I'll let you in on a little secret: I'm a bit of a paper folder myself (don't tell anyone, but my origami skills are still a work-in-progress). So, when I dived into Paper Trail, I was excited to see how the game would translate this tactile experience into a digital space. And boy, does it deliver!

The puzzle-solving is clever and challenging, yet not so difficult that you'll want to rip your hair out (although, let's be real, some of us might be prone to that). The world-building is whimsical and delightful, with a story that's sweet without being too sappy. Plus, the visuals are gorgeous - think watercolor come-to-life!

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But what about the other critics?" Ah, yes! Let me tell you, some of these reviewers were so enamored with Paper Trail that they barely contained their excitement (I'm looking at you, GAMINGbible). While others might have nitpicked a bit more (GameSpew, I'm talking to you), overall, the consensus is overwhelmingly positive.

In conclusion, if you're in the mood for something new and exciting in the world of puzzle games, Paper Trail is definitely worth giving a shot. Just remember: when life gives you lemons, make lemonade... but when life gives you paper, fold it into a swan!
